Technique: FORMED ON THE POTTER'S WHEEL; ENGOBE; PAINTED
Name: Cylix
Description: Truncate cone-shaped cylix, with rounded rim and unstable base with ring-shaped foot. Orangey-coloured paste. The surface is covered with a reddish coating. The outer rim presents a painted decoration consisting of festoons which are formed by intertwined semicircles in white and are delimited by black lines.
